It's been pretty constant for the past week. Okay. Has this happened to you before at all? No. Well, I've actually had a cold before, but not recently. Maybe like five years ago. Okay. Have you tried any over-the-counter medications at all? I've tried like e-congestants, and that's not, well, I guess my nose is running now, so that worked a little bit. Okay. Okay. I do. Okay. All right. Any medications that you're on besides insulin? No. No. Okay. Any allergies at all? No. Okay. Have you been hospitalized or had any surgeries before? No. No? Okay. Any family history of any medical conditions in particular with the lungs or the heart? No. No. Any autoimmune diseases? No. Okay. And currently right now, do you work or do you go to school? I'm in school right now. Okay. And so are you living where are you living right now? I live in an apartment by myself. Okay. And currently do you use any recreational drugs like marijuana or anything? No. Not okay. So not frequently, but maybe like once a month, I'll have an edible. Okay. Any other recreational drugs like cocaine, heroin, anything like that? Oh, no. No. And do you drink alcohol? No. And do you smoke tobacco? No. Okay. Yeah. Those were all the questions I have for you today. Do you have any questions for me? Yeah. How do I get rid of this? It's really been bugging me. Yeah. Kind of. So just the stuffiness and the runny nose. It seems like it's most likely a viral infection like the common cold. It takes a few weeks for the symptoms to get relieved, but there's not much that we can do besides supportive care. So make sure you get you stay well hydrated. And then once the results come back, you'll get further instructions from public health. Okay. That sounds great. Thank you. You're welcome. Take care. You too.
